details.title: Navy put on high alert in view of cyclone Gaja
details.content: Two Indian Naval ships -- Ranvir and Khanjar -- are standing by to proceed to the most affected areas to undertake humanitarian aid and distress relief, reported PTI.

Tamil Nadu: Latest visuals from Silver Beach in Cuddalore. #GajaCyclone is likely to make landfall between Pamban and Cuddalore today afternoon. pic.twitter.com/ME9UA1k3Cr

— ANI (@ANI) November 15, 2018
Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu on Monday directed the district collectors of all coastal districts in Andhra Pradesh to be on alert.

details.title: Karnataka districts may receive rain over weekend
details.content: According to the IMD, rainfall is forecast for districts of South Interior Karnataka including Bengaluru for three to four days, starting Thursday. During this period, light to moderate rainfall is expected to be fairly widespread.

Puducherry CM V Narayanasamy had on Wednesday held a review meeting with officials of various departments at Thirunallar in Karaikal district and took stock of the preparedness as cyclone Gaja is likely to hit the coastal district on November 15.

details.title: Do's and Don'ts
details.content:
DOs

  • Residents should follow instructions of TNSMART app;
  • Listen to announcements by radio and television;
  • Valuable documents should be kept in waterproof boxes;
  • Essential food items, water and medicines should be kept at least for seven days;
  • Torch lights, matchbox, battery, band-aid, knife, dry foods, glucose and first-aid box also should be kept ready.
  • Keep the doors and windows closed.
  • Drink boiled water, consume hygienic food,
  • Take care of the snapped electric cables,
  • Spray disinfectants in the surroundings

DON’Ts

  • Do not believe in any rumours.
  • Don't park vehicles under trees,
  • Don't travel in vehicles when the cyclone makes landfall,
  • Stay indoors till an official announcement is released by IMD about the landfall of the cyclone.
  • Fishermen should not venture into the sea.

A calm #Cuddalore port on Thursday morning . Not a single boat ventured into the sea due to #GajaCyclone. The port authorities hoisted the third warning flag. ⁦⁦@NewIndianXpress⁩. pic.twitter.com/GCX25AmCdy

— Harish Murali (@harismurali) November 15, 2018

According to the last update by the IMD, the cyclonic storm Gaja is located 370 km east-northeast of Nagapattinam as of 05.30 am. The storm will cross around the district during evening of 15th November with a wind speed of 80-90 kmph gusting to 100 kmph.

#Trains Partially Cancelled due to #Gaja Cyclone in #Tamilnadu @RailMinIndia pic.twitter.com/OgxXPz8dk8

— SouthCentralRailway (@SCRailwayIndia) November 14, 2018
The Pondicherry University on November 14 had issued a circular notifying about the postponement of the exam scheduled on November 15.

details.title: IMD released image as of 5.30 am
Power supply to be cut as precautionary measure
details.content:
During the hours when cyclone Gaja crosses coast, power supply will be cut in the concerned districts as a precautionary measure, says Electricity Minister P Thangamani @NewIndianXpress

— T Muruganandham (@muruga_TNIE) November 15, 2018

details.title: SCR partially cancels trains
details.content: Rameswaram station wears a deserted look as SCR partially cancels trains in view of Cyclone Gaja. (Photo | Ponmalar/EPS)

details.title: Cyclone Gaja keeps officials on their toes
details.content:
#TamilNadu: Collector Cuddalore Thiru. V. Anbuselvan and Disaster Managment Incharge Gagandeep Singh Bedi hold review meeting. #GajaCyclone is likely to make landfall between Pamban and Cuddalore today afternoon. pic.twitter.com/JabQiLepcq

— ANI (@ANI) November 15, 2018

All government departments in Cuddalore will stay open throughout with officials present even during the nights in their respective offices as part of the preparedness for Cyclone Gaja, reports Express correspondent Harish Murali.

State ready to evacuate people from low lying area which are on #CycloneGaja path to 6812 relief centres, of which 121 are multi-purpose centres that can accommodate 2000 people in each centre. @tnsdma @NewIndianXpress

— Krishna Chaitanya (@Krish_TNIE) November 15, 2018

It's expected that Gaja Cyclone will make a landfall late in the night today, may be in South of Cuddalore, in Nagapattinam district. People should be well-prepared. The government is taking the best of its efforts in this regard, Gagandeep Singh Bedi, Special Officer for Disaster Management, Tamil Nadu to ANI.

In all probability #CycloneGaja to hit #TN coast near Nagappattinam today night not evening as predicted earlier. @tnsdma @NewIndianXpress

— Krishna Chaitanya (@Krish_TNIE) November 15, 2018

Let us take this message to each person in coastal districts particularly #Nagapattinam where landfall is most likely on late evening or night of 15th November to #Prepare4Gaja #ShareIfUCare " pic.twitter.com/H6dwYNK9QJ

— TN SDMA (@tnsdma) November 15, 2018
In a novel effort, the state government has roped in 8,200 trained volunteers to rescue pets and livestock in the coastal districts that are likely yo be hit by Cyclone Gaja.

#IMD latest 12.15 bulletin: The Cyclonic storm ‘GAJA’ over Southwest Bay of Bengal moved further west-southwestwards
with a speed of 14 kmph during past 06 hours and lay centered about 370 km east-southeast of
Chennai and 370 km of Nagapattinam @tnsdma @NewIndianXpress

— Krishna Chaitanya (@Krish_TNIE) November 15, 2018

"Four teams each of NDRF and TNDRF positioned in Nagapattinam. We have 380 first responders to respond to the needs of people and 159 responders to protect animals. Collector has commenced efforts to evacuate people: Additional Secy, Revenue & Admin, Chennai to ANI.

Evacuation of people from low lying areas in Nagapattinam started about 1,313 people moved into relief camps. #CycloneGaja @tnsdma @NewIndianXpress

— Krishna Chaitanya (@Krish_TNIE) November 15, 2018

The Tamil Nadu government has requested private companies and institutions to allow their employees to leave offices before 4 pm in Nagapattinam and neighboring districts in view of the cyclonic storm.
Rough sea along the Puducherry coast on thursday as Cyclone 'Gaja' is expected to land late evening. (Photo | G Pattabiraman/EPS)

140 fishing vessels from Chennai still at sea. State authorities seek coast guard help to communicate the #CycloneGaja warning and asked them to move to Nellore coast. @tnsdma @NewIndianXpress

— Krishna Chaitanya (@Krish_TNIE) November 15, 2018

Warning cage 8 has been hoisted for cyclone alert at Rameswaram. (Photo | Ponmalar/EPS)

Signal 8: A 'very danger' warning, which means the cyclone is now a severe or very severe cyclone and is expected to move keeping the port to its left. Surface winds are likely between 48 and 63 knots (approx. 90-120 kmph).

— Vinodh Arulappan (@VinodhArulappan) November 15, 2018

details.title: Cyclone Gaja storm moving at 22 kmph
details.content: Cyclone Gaja storm picks up pace moving at 22 kmph and is currently 240 km from Nagappattinam.

As per latest updates #GajaCyclone is likely to have landfall between 8 pm and 11 pm tonight in all probability in Nagapattinam District.

— TN SDMA (@tnsdma) November 15, 2018

Flag no 9 raised in #Cuddalore port signifying heavy damage as part of #CycloneGaja scare in the district. The #rains have just begun. ⁦@NewIndianXpress⁩ pic.twitter.com/rlyxGrDMgW

— Harish Murali (@harismurali) November 15, 2018

#GajaCycloneUpdate State restricts tourists and general people from taking selfies and entering sea in coastal districts. Police instructed to patrol the coasts especially the six coastal districts where the cyclone winds picked up speed. @tnsdma @NewIndianXpress

— Krishna Chaitanya (@Krish_TNIE) November 15, 2018
Tenth warning stage hosted at Nagapattinam. (Photo | EPS)
Cyclone 'Gaja' has intensified into a severe cyclonic storm and is expected to cross the south Tamil Nadu coast by late this evening or night.

details.title: Buses in 7 Tamil Nadu districts not to ply between 6 pm today and 6 am tomorrow
details.content: As per a Times of India report, Transport department has been advised not to operate buses between 6pm today and 6 am tomorrow in 7 districts including Cuddalore, Nagapattinam, Thanjavur and Tiruvarur.

details.content:

details.title: Cyclone likely to move west-southwestwards and cross Tamil Nadu coast between Pamban and Cuddalore at speed of 80-90 kmph
details.content: Cyclone is very likely to move west-southwestwards and cross Tamil Nadu coast between Pamban and Cuddalore, around Nagapattinam during late evening of today, the 15th November 2018 as a Cyclonic Storm with a wind speed of 80-90 kmph gusting to 100 kmph.: IMD

details.title: Boats moved to safer places by fishermen near Marakanam
Bharathidasan University postpones November 16 exams
details.content: Bharathidasan University has postponed all its semester examinations scheduled for Friday, November 16.

details.title: Over two thousand people moved to relief centres from Nagapattinam, Ramanathapuram and Thiruvarur
details.content:
#GajaCyclone 2572 people from low lying areas moved to relief centres so far from three districts Nagapattinam, Ramanathapuram and Thiruvarur. @tnsdma @NewIndianXpress

Visitors returning to safer areas as gushing winds hit the Marina beach in Chennai. (Photo| Ashwin Prasath/ EPS)

details.title: Cyclonic storm Gaja is now located at 138 km east-northeast of Nagapattinam: IMD
details.content: (Photo by Ashok Kumar)
Gaja is not expected to weaken and is expected to cross between Cuddalore and Vedaranayam as a strong Cyclone with winds clocking 100-120 km/hour: Tamil Nadu Weatherman.

details.title: Alagappa University exams postponed
details.content: All exams scheduled on 16 November 2018 in Alagappa University, Karaikudi, have been postponed.

Diploma examinations conducted by Directorate of Technical Education, Tamil Nadu for all Polytechnic colleges scheduled on 16 November (morning and evening session) has been postponed to November 22. (TV reports)

Storm surge of the height of about 1.0 meter above astronomical tide is very likely to inundate low lying areas of Nagapattinam, Thanjavur, Pudukkottai and Ramanathapuram districts of Tamil Nadu and Karaikal district of Puducherry at the time of landfall.

Current Wind speed is 100 to 110 kmph gusting to 120 kmph.

details.title: Tamil Nadu SDMA says stay inside till official announcement from Government

details.content:

details.title: Cyclone Gaja making landfall, 1 hour to cross from sea to land: MeT dept
details.content: The eye of Cyclone Gaja is now making a landfall between Nagapattinam and Vedaranyam. It will take 1 hour for it to fully cross from sea to land. The intensity of the wind will be less when the eye of cyclone falls on land and it will increase again gradually: Chennai MeT department

details.title: Cyclone Gaja: Half of the Eye crosses coast with windspeeds over 100 kmph
details.content: Half of the eye of Cyclone Gaja has crossed the villages between Nagapattinam and Vedaranyam with windspeed over 100 kmph speed leaving a trail of hundreds of fallen trees and wrecked houses in dozens of villages & two towns. Another half still to cross

details.title: Opposite side winds to begin, SDMA asks residents to remain indoors
details.content:
Please #Share to #SaveLives as #SevereCyclone #Gaja had a landfall now it may be LULL phase for some time and entire process will take nearly 3 more hours! Please stay inside as opposite direction wind will start in a short while.
#CycloneGaja #cyclone #GajaCycloneUpdates pic.twitter.com/KixHe7Tc9s

— TN SDMA (@tnsdma) November 15, 2018

details.title: Severe Cylone Gaja to weaken into cyclonic storm in 6 hours
details.content: Severe Cylonic storm Gaja is very likely to move nearly westwards and weaken gradually into a cyclonic storm during next 06 hours. Though centre of cyclone lies over land, rear sector of eye wall is still over sea. It will take about an hour to move over land: India Meteorological Department

Bulletin No 13- Severe Cyclonic Storm 'GAJA' over TN about 40 km NW of #Vedaranyam and 15 km NW of #Athirampattinam with wind speed of 100-110 kmph gusting to 120 kmph #CycloneGaja #CycloneAlert #GajaCycloneUpdate #Gaja pic.twitter.com/HWavF3jOVC

— TN SDMA (@tnsdma) November 15, 2018

Bulletin No 14- Severe Cyclonic Storm 'GAJA' over TN about 15 km NW of #Athirampattinam with wind speed of 90-110 kmph gusting to 110 kmph .#CycloneGaja #CycloneAlert #GajaCycloneUpdate #Gaja pic.twitter.com/caqvMiDmPA

— TN SDMA (@tnsdma) November 16, 2018

details.title: Latest Update from Coimbatore
details.content:
Due to heavy rain in Coimbatore, district, Collector TN Hariharan declared holiday for schools in the district @NewIndianXpress

— Prabhakar Tamilarasu (@Pkr_cbe) November 16, 2018
Tirupur and Nilgiris collectors have also declared leave for the schools in districts.

details.title: Scenes from Nagapattinam
details.content:
Tamil Nadu: Trees uprooted and houses damaged in Nagapattinam in the overnight rainfall and strong winds which hit the town. #GajaCyclone pic.twitter.com/9ObvcqJlDD

— ANI (@ANI) November 16, 2018

Tamil Nadu: Trees uprooted damaged in Nagapattinam in the overnight rainfall and strong winds which hit the town. NDRF team carrying out clearance work in the area. #GajaCyclone pic.twitter.com/N2LwKr1Mpc

— ANI (@ANI) November 16, 2018

details.title: Electric Poles and Transformers Uprooted in Nagapattinam
details.content:
Hundreds of electric poles and dozens of transformers down in #Nagapattinam district on the road between Nagapattinam & #Vedaranyam after the cyclone crossed the shore. Electricity remains cut in several places in coastal areas of the district.#CycloneGaja@NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/ICVLTUQ18q

— Antony Fernando ✒🔍📰 (@ExpressAnto) November 16, 2018

details.title: Schools Closed, University Exams Postponed
details.content: District Collectors of Madurai, Dindigul, Theni, Sivagangai, Virudhunagar and Ramnad declared holiday for schools in their respective districts due to rain, as these districts are facing continous rain with heavy wind. Madurai Kamaraj University postponed all the exams scheduled to be held today.

details.title: Power Blackout in Madurai
details.content: Electricity has been disconnected in the entire Madurai district. Due to cyclonic gust, trees have been uprooted in five places in the city.

details.title: Kodaikanal Faces Gaja Wrath
details.content: Intense rain in Kodaikanal with strong cyclonic gusts. Landslides reported in several parts. Transport suspended.

details.title: Madurai Water Body in Its Full Capacity.
details.content:
Tiruparankundram kanmoi, one of the largest water body in #Madurai breaming to its full capacity, due to heavy rain. Possibilities of tank bund to breach, break. Water touches the road. #CycloneGaja@NewIndianXpress

— Vinodh Arulappan (@VinodhArulappan) November 16, 2018

details.title: Two Naval Ships on Standby
details.content: INS Ranvir and INS Khanjar have been on standby to proceed to the most affected areas to undertake humanitarian aid distress relief (HADR), evacuation, logistic support including providing medical aid. These ships will be embarked with additional divers, doctors, inflatable rubber boats, integral helicopters and relief material. (READ THE FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Cyclone Gaja Weakens
details.content: Severe Cyclonic Storm Gaja now weakens in to Cyclonic storm to NE of Kodaikanal and Dindigul with wind speed of 65-75 kmph gusting to 85 kmph.

Electric poles and trees uprooted in Kodaikanal hill station due to the gusts of #CycloneGaja @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/k32VQNKGVZ

— Vinodh Arulappan (@VinodhArulappan) November 16, 2018

details.title: Tamil Nadu Government Announces Compensation
details.content: Tamil Nadu CM Edappadi Palaniswami says Rs 10 lakh each would be given as solatium to each of victims of Gaja cyclone. He also said that so far 11 persons died across the State in rain-related incidents.

details.title: State Ministers to Stay at Cylcone-affected Areas: Palaniswami
details.content: Palaniswami has also directed state Ministers to camp at cyclone-affected areas to expedite the relief and rescue operations."Central government never sanctioned what the State government asked as assistance for natural calamities. Most of the works are being done with the funds of State government," the CM said.

District Monitoring officer Darmendra Pradap Yadav, District Collector Natarajan, Corporation Commissioner Anees Shekar inspects the Tiruparankundram kanmoi.

Kudos Officers! pic.twitter.com/6JqaDFYx4L

— Vinodh Arulappan (@VinodhArulappan) November 16, 2018

details.content:
Bulletin No 46- #SevereCyclonicStorm #CycloneGaja over coastal TN about 95km west of #Atiramapattinam & 110km NE of #kodaikanal . Likely to move westwards and weakened into an deep depression during next 3hrs. Wind speed of Thondi &Thiruchirapalli 55 kmph at 0830 hrs #Gaja pic.twitter.com/NlyOCkfMvT

details.content:
Chennai Metrological department warns heavy rain in #madurai, #Theni and #Dindigul.
After effects of #CycloneGaja @NewIndianXpress

— Vinodh Arulappan (@VinodhArulappan) November 16, 2018

details.title: Relief camps set up at Valparai as a precautionary measure
details.content: Meterological Department predicts heavy rainfall in Coimbatore, Nilgiris and Tirupur districts on the wake of Cyclone Gaja. Temporary shelters have been set up in Valparai as a precautionary measure.

details.title: Latest from Cuddalore
details.content:
Three persons were killed, four houses demolished, 13600 evacuated and kept in 105 shelters, 158 trees uprooted and 20 electric poles fell in #Cuddalore due to the 14 cm rainfall of #Gajastorm @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/0a1KZXJdmd

— Harish Murali (@harismurali) November 16, 2018

details.title: Visuals from Villupuram
details.content:
Three houses and more than ten trees washed away in Bhoomiyarpalayam at Villupuram district @NewIndianXpress #CycloneGaja pic.twitter.com/uIJorayHzw

— Bagalavan Perier B (@Bagalavan_TNIE) November 16, 2018

details.title: Kerala Issues Alert for Fishermen
details.content: Kerala fishermen have been advised not to venture into the Arabian Sea along and off the Kerala coast from Friday evening. They have also been warned to keep off the south-east Arabian Sea and Lakshadweep areas on Sunday and Monday as well.

details.title: Rajnath Assures Help to Tamil Nadu
details.content: Union Home Minister Rajnath Singh calls up Tamil Nadu CM Palaniswami and enquiries about situation in cyclone affected areas. He has also assured all possible assistance from Centre. The Union Home Secretary to monitor situation and provide all help to Tamil Nadu.

Fisheries Min D Jayakumar says due to foolproof precautionary measures taken ahead of cyclone Gaja, not even a single fishermen has been affected; boats in 333 fishing hamlets affected by cyclone Gaja; enumeration on the number of boats damaged is already on @NewIndianXpress

— T Muruganandham (@muruga_TNIE) November 16, 2018

Fisheries Minister D Jayakumar thanks opposition leaders who have commended the precuationary measures taken by State Disaster Management Authority to tackale cyclone Gaja; says opposition parties should act like catalysts.

details.title: Nagapattinam District Heavily Affected
details.content:
Nagapattinam district has been heavily damaged by #GajaCyclone. In total, 471 relief camps have been established in which 81,948 ppl are staying. We"ll seek assistance from central govt after assessment is done by our officials in the affected areas: Tamil Nadu CM E Palaniswamy pic.twitter.com/7lA4J3U1lz

— ANI (@ANI) November 16, 2018

#VaigaiExpress halted nearly for 5 hours near #Dindigul due to gusts of #CycloneGaja @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/6pOfTjlBBA

— Vinodh Arulappan (@VinodhArulappan) November 16, 2018

details.title: Cyclone enters Kerala
details.content: Cyclone Gaja crosses Tamil Nadu coast to enter Idukki in Kerala.

details.title: Anna University reschedules exam dates
details.content:
#CycloneGaja #AnnaUniversity reschedules dates for exams that were to be held on 15th and 16th November.https://t.co/G6VgoJNwOz

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) November 16, 2018

details.title: Kerala woman killed in Kodaikanal after tree falls on her car
details.content:
A 25 year old Nilini from Thrissur - Kerala State was killed as a tree fell on her car at Kodaikanal. Her husband and one year old child sustained injury.#CycloneGaja @NewIndianXpress

— Vinodh Arulappan (@VinodhArulappan) November 16, 2018

details.title: Two dead in Sivagangai
details.content:
Two deaths reported in Sivagangai district.

Elisabeth Rani, a resident of Tirupattur died after a tree fell on her.
Muthu Murugan, a Revenue Inspector at Illayankudi crushed by wall collapse after heavy rain. #CycloneGaja @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/hhhlTMlNwl

— Vinodh Arulappan (@VinodhArulappan) November 16, 2018

details.title: Cyclone Gaja wreaks havoc in Tamil Nadu

details.title: Heavy rain lashes parts of Idukki, triggering landslides, mudslides and damage
details.content: An image of people crossing a road in Idukki that caved in. (Photo | Special arrangement)

details.title: LATEST FROM IMD: Deep depression has weakened into a depression over central Kerala
details.content:
The deep depression over interior Tamilnadu moved west-southwestwards, weakened into a depression and lay centred at 5:30 om today, the 16th November, 2018, over central Kerala near latitude 10.1°N and longitude 76.4°E, about 20 km east-northeast of Kochi. It is very likely to move nearly westwards and emerge into southeast Arabian Sea during next 12 hours.

Bulletin No 48 - #SevereCyclonicStorm #CycloneGaja The deep depression over TN moved west-southwest wards over central kerala and emerge into SE of #Arabiansea during next 12 hrs #Gaja #GajaCycloneUpdate pic.twitter.com/3HeZTNoDMt

— TN SDMA (@tnsdma) November 16, 2018

details.title: PM offers condolences, promises support
details.content:
PM Narendra Modi calls up TN CM EPS and enquires about the situation due to cyclonic conditions. Condoles the loss of lives and promises all possible help from the Central government @NewIndianXpress

— T Muruganandham (@muruga_TNIE) November 16, 2018

details.title: WATCH VIDEO
details.content:
#CycloneGaja crossed #TamilNadu & #Puducherry Coast this morning with wind gusting at 110 kmph. Very Rough Sea condition prevails over #TamilNadu Coast. #CoastGuard advisories in vernacular languages saw more than 470 fishing boats returning safe to harbour @DefenceMinIndia pic.twitter.com/opHw576j1M

— Indian Coast Guard (@IndiaCoastGuard) November 16, 2018

details.title: Navy sends two ships to Karaikal
details.content:
#CycloneGaja Two #IndianNavy ships Chetlat & Cheriam diverted to Karaikal to render assistance to state authorities as reqd. for disaster relief operations. 03 ships standing-by at Chennai & 02 ships at Vizag to augment HADR efforts @SpokespersonMoD @nsitharaman @DefenceMinIndia

— SpokespersonNavy (@indiannavy) November 16, 2018
